Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir

After considerable travel discomfort due to the great shortage of horses in these parts, I arrived on the 4th of the current month in this district of Vacaria, having the satisfaction, however, of finding everything calm, as well as favorable news from São Paulo, a reason why it seems to me for now unnecessary the march of Lieutenant Colonel Rodrigo, and sufficient the company of Captain José Antônio de Oliveira, who marched with me and whom I leave in position over the Antas, at the Passo de Cima, in this district, until my return from Lages to which I proceed today, where I was able to obtain some horses in very poor condition, to go slowly marching; and from there, with better information, I will communicate to Your Excellency Cima da Serra, as this one, that they are in the most woeful state possible, both in horses and cattle, which are found only in few parts.
